no.patternsolutions.javann
Class Bam

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      no.patternsolutions.javann.NeuralNet
          no.patternsolutions.javann.Bam
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Bam
extends NeuralNet

A neural network that consists of two fully interconnected layers of processing nodes. First described in 1988 by B. Kosko

See Also:
Serialized Form

run

public boolean[][] run(boolean[] patternIn,
                       boolean[] patternOut)
Test the network with a set of input nodes.

Parameters:
patternIn - input a table of nodes for the input layer if we want to find the corresponding output layer or 'null' if the input layer is the layer to be found
patternOut - input a table of nodes for the output layer if we want to find the corresponding input layer or 'null' if the output layer is the layer to be found
Returns:
a table of nodes to to both layers. The input layer in index 0, and the output layer in index 1

setBipolar

public void setBipolar(boolean bipolar)
Enables use of bipolar or binary data for the nodes in the network.

Parameters:
bipolar - true if bipolar data should be enabled (used), false if binary data should be enabled (used).

trainPatterns

public void trainPatterns(boolean[][] inputs,
                          boolean[][] outputs)
Trains the input and output patterns given.

Parameters:
inputs - input the patterns for the input layer
outputs - input the patterns for the output layer
